Bald Eagle Students fare well in Centre County Virtual Livestock Show

With the cancellation of the Centre County Grange fair, Centre County youth with 4-H and FFA livestock projects were challenged with not having the opportunity to compete with their project animals. A local family in the agriculture community sponsored the Centre County Virtual Open Livestock Show. Youth submitted video coverage of their projects that were evaluated by professional livestock judges. The judges selected the top five animals in each species. The Champion and Reserve Champion received banners and premium money. Third through fifth places overall received premium money. Several Bald Eagle Area 4-H and FFA members competed in the respective livestock competitions.
BEEF:
Champion Steer: Mackenzie Stine, 2017 graduate showing through FFA
Reserve Champion Steer: Kurt Hall, 2018 graduate showing through FFA
Third Overall Steer: Mackenzie Stine
PIGS:
Reserve Champion Swine: Wyatt Knepp, 6th grader
Fourth Overall Pig: Shawn Knepp, 9th grader
Fifth Overall Pig: Mackenzie Stine

Today we remember what our dads do for us. Happy Father’s Day.

On this Memorial Day we remember we are the home of the free because of the brave.

A quote from Ronald Reagan at Arlington National Cemetery, May 31, 1982: "The United States and the freedom for which it stands, the freedom for which they died, must endure and prosper. Their lives remind us that freedom is not bought cheaply. It has a cost; it imposes a burden. And just as they whom we commemorate were willing to sacrifice, so too must we—in a less final, less heroic way—be willing to give of ourselves."

Happy Memorial Day !

post_text: Today we celebrated Veterans and Military personal at an all school assembly organized by our high school. Each elementary school had a 5th grade student read an essay he/she had written for today’s event. A special thanks to Stacy Irvin for her inspiring message and all the veterans and military personal in attendance. One classroom displayed a sign which read “ Heroes don’t wear capes, they wear dog tags!” We will never forget the sacrifices that were given for our freedom. We thank you and honor you!
